All Classes

Class Summary 
Class Description
Agent
Abstract class providing a skeletal implementation of the tic-tac-toe-playing agent
AgentLevel0
Class implementing level 0 of the tic-tac-toe-playing agent, which uses a random number generator to choose random valid moves for the agent
AgentLevel1
Class implementing level 1 of the tic-tac-toe-playing agent, which uses a hard-coded set of conditions to choose the best move for the agent
AgentLevel2
Class implementing level 2 of the tic-tac-toe-playing agent, which employs the regular minimax algorithm (a depth-first search strategy for adversarial games) and features a complete adversarial search
AgentLevel3
Class implementing level 3 of the tic-tac-toe-playing agent, which employs the regular minimax algorithm (a depth-first search strategy for adversarial games) and features a reduced search space resulting from alpha-beta pruning
AgentLevel4
Class implementing level 4 of the tic-tac-toe-playing agent, which employs a depth-sensitive minimax algorithm (a depth-first search strategy for adversarial games) and features a complete adversarial search
AgentLevel5
Class implementing level 5 of the tic-tac-toe-playing agent, which employs a depth-sensitive minimax algorithm (a depth-first search strategy for adversarial games) and features a reduced search space resulting from alpha-beta pruning
Board
Class implementing the 3×3 tic-tac-toe board consisting of the tiles on which the players place their tokens
ChooseFirst
Class implementing a window for selecting whether the player or the agent goes first
ChooseFirstController
Class providing the controller for the processes related to the selection of the first player to move
ChooseLevel
Class implementing a window for the selection of the intelligence level of the agent
ChooseLevelController
Class providing the controller for the processes related to the selection of the intelligence level of the tic-tac-toe-playing agent
Coordinates
Class implementing a pair of coordinates (row- and column-coordinates) to describe the location of tiles in the 3×3 tic-tac-toe board
Evaluation
Class implementing a move evaluation of the agent, consisting of both the move and the numerical evaluation of this move
GameMaster
Class implementing the game master of this tic-tac-toe program, the central class that provides access to all the methods necessary to run the system
MainScreen
Class implementing the main window of the system, displaying the tic tac toe board alongside some details regarding the game (such as the description of the intelligence level, the decision time of the agent, the move sequence of the agent and player, and the number of wins and draws of both parties)
MainScreenController
Class providing the controller for the processes related to the main screen of the system (that is, the tic-tac-toe board together with the pertinent details and statistics)
TicTacToe
Class for activating the tic-tac-toe game, which features six levels of gameplay against an intelligent system
